page.title: 03TOWN COUNCIL
page.content: The{Town Council}is an elected body to run the affairs of a town. Barton-on-Humber Town Council holds meetings in{Baysgarth House}twice a month,the first Wednesday and the third Monday.There are 22 members in the council including the mayor.The members of the council are divided up into two wards,Bridge ward and Park ward,with eleven members in each ward. Councillors are elected by the electors of their ward every 4 years. Since 1974 Barton has been a part of{ {Glanford Borough}Council and elects 4 councillors to that body.Glanford Borough Council makes all final decisions affecting Barton and the surrounding areas.Barton Town Council has become a forum for discussion of local issues and offers advice to Glanford Borough Council.Traffic and vandalism are major issues in 1985.
